ghaffarian.graphs

Class Graph<V,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghaffarian.graphs.Graph<V,E>

  • public class Graph<V,E>
extends Object
    A generic class for labeled graphs. This class supports both directed and undirected graphs.
    Author:
    Seyed Mohammad Ghaffarian

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph(boolean directed)
        Construct a new empty Graph object with the given direction property.
        Parameters:
        directed - specify if graph is directed (true) or undirected (false)

    • Method Detail

      • addVertex

        public boolean addVertex(V v)
        Add the given vertex to this graph.
        Returns:
        true if the vertex is added, or false if such vertex is already in the graph.

      • removeVertex

        public boolean removeVertex(V v)
        Remove the given vertex from this graph.
        Returns:
        true if the vertex is removed, or false if no such vertex is in the graph.

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge(Edge<V,E> e)
        Add the given edge to this graph. Both vertices (source and target) of the edge must be in the graph otherwise, an exception is thrown indicating this issue.
        Returns:
        true if the edge is added, or false if the edge is already in the graph.

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge(V src,
                       V trgt)
        Add an edge to this graph, connecting the given vertices. If a new edge can be added, the label of this new edge will be 'null'. Both vertices (source and target) of the edge must be in the graph otherwise, an exception is thrown indicating this issue.
        Returns:
        true if a new edge is added, or false if such an edge is already in the graph.

      • removeEdge

        public boolean removeEdge(Edge<V,E> e)
        Remove the given edge from this graph.
        Returns:
        true if the vertex is removed, or false if no such vertex is in the graph.

      • removeEdges

        public Set<Edge<V,E>> removeEdges(V src,
                                  V trgt)
        Remove all edges in this graph between the given source vertex and target vertex.
        Returns:
        the set of edges removed from this graph as a result of this operation.

      • addGraph

        public boolean addGraph(Graph<V,E> graph)
        Adds all vertices and edges of the given graph to this graph.
        Returns:
        true if this graph was modified; otherwise false.

      • vertexCount

        public int vertexCount()
        Return the number of vertices in this graph.

      • edgeCount

        public int edgeCount()
        Return the number of edges in this graph.

      • enumerateAllEdges

        public Enumeration<Edge<V,E>> enumerateAllEdges()
        Return an enumeration over all edges of the graph.

      • enumerateAllVertices

        public Enumeration<V> enumerateAllVertices()
        Return an enumeration over all vertices of the graph.

      • copyEdgeSet

        public Set<Edge<V,E>> copyEdgeSet()
        Return a copy of the set of all edges in this graph. This method has the overhead of creating of copy of the current set of edges. Hence the returned collection is safe to use and modify (it is not linked to this graph).

      • copyVertexSet

        public Set<V> copyVertexSet()
        Return a copy of the set of all vertices in this graph. This method has the overhead of creating of copy of the current set of vertices. Hence the returned collection is safe to use and modify (it is not linked to this graph).

      • enumerateIncomingEdges

        public Enumeration<Edge<V,E>> enumerateIncomingEdges(V v)
        Return an enumeration over the set of incoming edges to the given vertex.

      • enumerateOutgoingEdges

        public Enumeration<Edge<V,E>> enumerateOutgoingEdges(V v)
        Return an enumeration over the set of outgoing edges from the given vertex.

      • copyIncomingEdges

        public Set<Edge<V,E>> copyIncomingEdges(V v)
        Return a copy of the set of incoming edges to the given vertex. This method has the overhead of creating of copy of the current set of incoming edges. Hence the returned collection is safe to use and modify (it is not linked to this graph).

      • copyOutgoingEdges

        public Set<Edge<V,E>> copyOutgoingEdges(V v)
        Return a copy of the set of outgoing edges from the given vertex. This method has the overhead of creating of copy of the current set of outgoing edges. Hence the returned collection is safe to use and modify (it is not linked to this graph).

      • getInDegree

        public int getInDegree(V v)
        Return the count of incoming edges to the given vertex.

      • getOutDegree

        public int getOutDegree(V v)
        Return the count of outgoing edges from the given vertex.

      • getEdgesWithLabel

        public Set<Edge<V,E>> getEdgesWithLabel(E label)
        Return the set of edges with a label same as the given value.

      • containsEdge

        public boolean containsEdge(Edge<V,E> e)
        Check if this graph contains the given edge.

      • containsEdge

        public boolean containsEdge(V src,
                            V trg)
        Check if this graph contains an edge between the given vertices.

      • containsVertex

        public boolean containsVertex(V v)
        Check if this graph contains the given vertex.

      • isSubgraphOf

        public boolean isSubgraphOf(Graph<V,E> base)
        Check if this graph is a subgraph of the given base graph.

      • isProperSubgraphOf

        public boolean isProperSubgraphOf(Graph<V,E> base)
        Check if this graph is a proper subgraph of the given base graph. A proper subgraph is a subgraph which is not equal to the base graph. A proper subgraph lacks at least on vertex or edge compared to the base.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Check whether this graph is connected or not. Connectivity is determined by a breadth-first-traversal starting from a random vertex.
